headline: Here's Why Shares in United Airlines Sagged This Week
summary: Shares in United Airlines (NASDAQ: UAL) fell by 14.2% in the week to Friday morning.  While the drive to ensure a level playing field in international trade is entirely understandable, the immediate imposition of tariffs will naturally create, at the least, a period of instability as the global economy adjusts.  As a transportation company and an airline with relatively large exposure to transatlantic travel, United is susceptible to changes in consumer discretionary spending and corporate travel plans, which are both likely to be negatively impacted by tariffs and similar actions.

headline: Southwest Airlines’ Turnaround Comes With Plenty of Baggage
summary: The Texas-based carrier is adding baggage fees and attempting a turnaround just as the industry appears headed for a slump.
